channel.title: So What's Due? | Survey Research Methods

item.title: A Bit More on Categorical Data
item.description:
• What’s Due?

What’s Due?

eCampus Data Camp Qualtrics Description Location
Complete a module on categorical data. Link

item.title: Coding and Recoding Scaled Items
item.description:
• What’s Due?
  • Things to Consider

What’s Due?

eCampus Data Camp Qualtrics Description Location
If you have Likert scale items and even if you do not use R, you must consider recoding items which may be in the opposite direction of your other items. Called an effect of polarity, your conclusions are inherently dependent on your scales pointed in the same direction. Link
Complete another module on categorical data. Link
Review some materials on survey items and get an overview of one of the most important types of analyses: Item Response Theory (IRT). We’ll learn more about IRT and cover exploratory factor analysis (EFA) next week! Link

Things to Consider

While there is nothing to turn in this week, please think about your plan of analysis ahead of time.

item.title: How to Write Open- and Closed-Ended Questions
item.description:
• What’s Due?
  • Things coming up

What’s Due?

eCampus Data Camp Qualtrics Description Location
Participate in the EDP 619 Survey About Nothing1. A unique Qualtrics link was sent to your WVU MIX email at 8am on September 15.
Watch a walkthrough on getting rid of the Qualtrics logo in your survey. Link

Things coming up

  • Data Camp modules.
  • Survey Draft.

  1. We’ll be using R to pull the results directly out of Qualtrics, namely out of something called the Qualtrics API.↩︎
